findings.title: Pyramid scan has no shared contract in shared-contracts.md
Expansion re-launch contradicts itself and breaks monitoring contract
Expansion loop creates unpredictable wait times with no user progress signal
Keyword extraction mismatch — plan file vs docs/solutions/ frontmatter
Autonomous mode removes checkpoints without rollback/pause mechanism
Spec completeness grep heuristics will false-positive
Autonomous batch mode creates second dispatch-mode axis (2x2 with clodex)
Batch=ALL risks context window exhaustion on 20+ task plans
All three proposals splice into lfg.md without coordinating step numbering
No user opt-out or override mechanism for any feature
Summarization cost unaccounted — orchestrator overhead offsets 30-50% of claimed savings
Two parallel content-assembly systems (pyramid + diff slicing) to maintain

improvements.title: Unify pyramid scan and diff slicing under single content-assembly abstraction
Wire into write-plan (Option B) first; defer lfg insertion until validated
Collapse autonomous mode into clodex toggle rather than new flag
Define named insertion points in lfg.md instead of numbered step splicing
Add pause escape hatch + mandatory incremental commits in autonomous mode
Surface pyramid mode at Step 1.3 confirmation with user override option
Skip step entirely when docs/solutions/ has <5 files
Ship with feature flags for incremental rollout
Add task-count ceiling (batch=min(ALL,10)) to prevent context blowout
Instrument token usage per agent before implementing to validate savings claims
